title: Computer Graphics
subtitle: Learn the concepts behind 2D/3D graphics, transformations, and rendering

topics.title: Introduction to Computer Graphics
topics.description: Definition and scope of computer graphics, applications (gaming, CAD, simulation, UI design), history and evolution of graphics systems, overview of graphics pipeline and rendering process.

topics.title: Graphics Hardware and Software
topics.description: Graphics system architecture, input devices (keyboard, mouse, light pen, digitizers, scanners), output devices (raster and random scan displays, printers), graphics software (libraries, APIs like OpenGL, DirectX), and graphics pipeline stages (modeling, transformation, lighting, projection, clipping, rasterization).

topics.title: 2D Transformations
topics.description: Basic transformations (translation, scaling, rotation), composite transformations, homogeneous coordinates and transformation matrices, coordinate systems, and transformations between them.

topics.title: 3D Transformations
topics.description: 3D translation, scaling, rotation about axes (X, Y, Z), viewing coordinate system, viewing pipeline (modeling, viewing, projection), and introduction to viewing volume and clipping in 3D.

topics.title: Line and Circle Drawing Algorithms
topics.description: Line drawing algorithms (DDA, Bresenham’s line algorithm), circle drawing algorithms (Bresenham’s circle algorithm, Midpoint circle algorithm), implementation considerations, and optimizations.

topics.title: Clipping Algorithms
topics.description: Line clipping (Cohen-Sutherland algorithm, Liang-Barsky algorithm), polygon clipping (Sutherland-Hodgman algorithm), clipping window, and viewport.

topics.title: Projection
topics.description: Orthographic projection (characteristics and uses), perspective projection (concept, vanishing point, perspective divide), and comparison between orthographic and perspective projections.

topics.title: Shading and Rendering
topics.description: Basic rendering pipeline overview, illumination models (ambient, diffuse, specular reflections), shading techniques (flat shading, Gouraud shading, Phong shading), introduction to texture mapping, and basic rendering concepts.
